author: barnabasbusa
content: Is there any reason to use the withdrawal queue for partial withdrawals? https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/2862 What exactly is the reason to still have a withdrawal queue for the partial withdrawals? I'd personally prefer if partial withdrawals could be accessible by everyone at any epoch instead of filling up the exit queue.

author: ralexstokes
content: it simplifies implementation to just have one withdrawal queue

author: ralexstokes
content: they are all withdrawals and the question is just how much of the validators balance can be stripped off based on their consensus lifecycle state and what that means for PoS security

author: barnabasbusa
content: In what way do partial (up to leaving a balance of 32eth) withdrawals affect the security of ethereum?

author: ralexstokes
content: the security properties have more to do with where and how the validator's stake is at risk

author: ralexstokes
content: if i was a validator with say 20 ETH balance and i just suddenly withdrew 10 ETH, it would circumvent the gating mechanisms we use to ensure that any slashable behavior can actually materialize into a penalty against some real assset

author: ralexstokes
content: the way the protocol works today, any balance over 32 ETH doesn't really affect the protocol and is kind of just sitting locked at the CL

author: ralexstokes
content: so wrt security the protocol execution is isomorphic if we allow partial withdrawals of balance over this threshold

author: djrtwo
content: withdrawals induce a load on the execution layer

author: djrtwo
content: numbers can/should still be tuned to an appropriate load
